[h1]I have to say, initial impressions of Overwatch 2 has been quite underwhelming. [/h1]

We waited years for more PvE content.. Is, is that it? Surely that's not all the new content. There has to be something else, right? You've got to be kidding me. 

[b]You see, Stanley? 
[u]This is what happens when a video game developer with no respect for their fanbase rush a cheap expansion to make an easy 15$![/b][/u]

[i]In fact, I'm looking right now [/i]at the game achievements and it's hard to believe, one of them actually says 
"Level 50, Earn 50 battle pass tiers. Please ignore!"

What quality assurance department signed off on this? 
I'm infuriated and disappointed.

猫

从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。

后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，可是它挣脱我，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走，还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了.....

后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受，
可是我不会再要它了
。

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

The rotting corpse of a game full of so many nostalgic memories. If you end up playing, have fun dodging the in game micro-transactions and horrific balancing. 

"We know more about what the players want then the players themselves" - Blizzard exec that has never played a game in their life

由于对这个游戏以前玩了那么久的执念，还是下载了一个玩。

体验感不好，延迟肉眼可见的高。以前的英雄也都没了，2刚出时有1的玩家至少保留了以前的那些英雄。

暴雪成功把自己开先河式的游戏类型玩没了，吃相难看。现在又想学APEX通过别的平台曲线救国，但人家前面可不是因为这种骚操作而流失玩家的啊…1因为不出英雄、不弄活动、不把玩家意见反馈当回事在走下坡路放出2消息的时候，退坑的朋友已经是大多数。

但是群里仍有朋友预购了2，对PVE模式有所期待。

前段时间，还抱着国服被别的厂商买回版权的心态可以再偶尔玩下，毕竟以前打到宗师+8把金武器+各种皮肤竞技点数，在一天天的等待中，也没有那种想接着玩下去的热情了，挥手告别学生时代那几年对这个游戏倾注的时间和感情。

已卸载。

From its promising beginnings as the GOTY 2016 winner, Overwatch swiftly revealed itself to be a monumental testament to Blizzard's inability to manage a game of this magnitude. It's astonishing how a title that began with so much potential could be so tragically mishandled.

To dive into one of the most glaring examples of Blizzard's ineptitude - Brigitte. A hero they thrust into the game as a band-aid solution to their own failure: the Dive-Meta. Instead of implementing a sophisticated balance patch to address the stagnating Meta, Blizzard chose to scramble together a completely overpowered character to counter any high skill hero at the time. I can't even remember how many times Brigitte had to be nerfed, it seemed like she wasn't playtested at all. 

But it wasn’t just Brigitte. It's the cascade of missteps and sheer incompetence displayed in almost every subsequent aspect of the game. The balance patches often felt more like wild stabs in the dark than the product of calculated, informed decisions. The game's meta would oscillate from one extreme to another, with players being subjected to an unpredictable and often frustrating environment.

Blizzard's mismanagement isn't just confined to in-game balance, either. Communication between developers and the community has been lackluster at best, with feedback often seeming to fall on deaf ears. It's a heartbreaking spectacle, watching a titan of the gaming world fumble so disastrously with a franchise that once held such potential. Also let's not even talk about catastrophe that is the Overwatch League - a supposed pinnacle of eSports competition. A masterclass in how not to run a competitive scene.

To sum up, Overwatch could've been the hallmark of online team-based shooters. Instead, thanks to Blizzard's inability to competently balance and manage the game, it stands as a cautionary tale for future developers. If you're considering diving into this title now, my advice? Save your time, your patience, and your sanity.

First things first; There's no doubt that the whole PVE debacle deserves backlash, and that Blizzard itself is rightly scorned for its behaviour and conduct.

But looking at the game itself as it is actually played, there's a solid and polished core gameplay loop that keeps me playing. The movement feels good, landing shots is super satisfying and even healing your teammates as a support is fun in its own right. Yeah, healing can actually be fun! Who knew?

The variety is a strength as well, picking up a new hero and delving deep into how you play them effectively doesn't get old, and with how many heroes there are, there's a real feeling of discovery and experimentation in that process. 

The writing and the characters themselves can be pretty great too, they play off of each other well and having your chosen hero say a one liner when you do something cool is a quintessential Overwatch experience.

It's not all positives though, the readability in the game has always been a weakness. Unless you have many hours in it already, it can be very hard to understand what is actually happening in said game. I've streamed it a few times to friends of mine who have never played, or played very little, and there's scarcely been a moment when they have had any clue as to what is going on. The game is very fast paced, full of particle effects and might as well be a new language to new players.

On top of that, it can be an incredibly frustrating experience. You rely heavily on your teammates in this game, moreso than other shooters I've played, and this often leads to the experience of feeling like you're doing everything right and still losing or even doing everything wrong and still winning. The readability issues coupled with this heavy team reliance can be a serious problem. 

Relying on your teammates isn't necessarily a bad thing though, as getting that team that you jive with can be just as fun as how unfun the game can be when you don't, but it is definitely something to keep in mind if you try the game or even play it currently.

I'd still say that the game is very much worth trying and playing, I feel like there's something in it for everyone and I'm looking forward to seeing new players try it because of the new season and its Steam release.
